abstract: Alexis Soloski reviews William Burke play Comfort Dogs: Live From the Pink House, starring both human and canine actors, at Jack in Clinton Hill as part of Damnable Scribbling series.
lead_paragraph: This experimental play by William Burke, whose cast includes dogs played by humans and real dogs, forces you to look at the nature of communication a little differently.

headline.main: Review: ‘Comfort Dogs’ Explores the Solace of Communing With Canines
headline.print_headline: Inside the Head of a Pooch Who Just Wants You to Be Happy

snippet: This experimental play by William Burke, whose cast includes dogs played by humans and real dogs, forces you to look at the nature of communication a little differently.
